SEARCH
Package org.lwjgl.assimp

Class AISkeletonBone

java.lang.Object
org.lwjgl.system.Pointer.Default
org.lwjgl.system.Struct
org.lwjgl.assimp.AISkeletonBone
All Implemented Interfaces:
AutoCloseable, NativeResource, Pointer
public class AISkeletonBone extends Struct implements NativeResource

Layout


 struct aiSkeletonBone {
     int mParent();
     struct aiNode * mArmature();
     struct aiNode * mNode();
     unsigned int mNumnWeights();
     struct aiMesh * mMeshId();
     struct aiVertexWeight * mWeights();
     struct aiMatrix4x4 mOffsetMatrix();
     struct aiMatrix4x4 mLocalMatrix();
 }

  • Constructor Details

    • AISkeletonBone

      public AISkeletonBone(ByteBuffer container)
      Creates a AISkeletonBone instance at the current position of the specified ByteBuffer container. Changes to the buffer's content will be visible to the struct instance and vice versa.

      The created instance holds a strong reference to the container object.

  • Method Details

    • sizeof

      public int sizeof()
      Description copied from class: Struct
      Returns sizeof(struct).
      Specified by:

    • mParent

      public int mParent()
      the parent bone index, is -1 one if this bone represents the root bone

    • mArmature

      @Nullable public AINode mArmature()
      The bone armature node - used for skeleton conversion.

      You must enable Process_PopulateArmatureData to populate this.

    • mNode

      @Nullable public AINode mNode()
      The bone node in the scene - used for skeleton conversion.

      You must enable Process_PopulateArmatureData to populate this.

    • mNumnWeights

      public int mNumnWeights()
      the number of weights

    • mMeshId

      public AIMesh.Buffer mMeshId()
      the mesh index, which will get influenced by the weight

    • mWeights

      public AIVertexWeight.Buffer mWeights()
      the influence weights of this bone, by vertex index

    • mOffsetMatrix

      public AIMatrix4x4 mOffsetMatrix()
      Matrix that transforms from bone space to mesh space in bind pose.

      This matrix describes the position of the mesh in the local space of this bone when the skeleton was bound. Thus it can be used directly to determine a desired vertex position, given the world-space transform of the bone when animated, and the position of the vertex in mesh space.

      It is sometimes called an inverse-bind matrix, or inverse bind pose matrix.

    • mLocalMatrix

      public AIMatrix4x4 mLocalMatrix()
      matrix that transforms the local bone in bind pose
